text:
[Section: Page 832 of 1048]



Yes split that joint fidelity account 50/50. All other accounts will be frozen, including fidelity with msft stock, retirement accounts, hsa accounts etc,
so no further stock sales or movement of money out.
The amount we receive now will be factored in once we finalize the final asset split.
The amount we receive will be used by each of us to pay our own expenses moving forward. You pay your rent, upkeep of rental, insurance, food,
clothing, etc. Yes I pay for my Botox, and other personal expenses including home mortgage payment, clothing etc
At final settlement, we will settle up anything that was paid individually that should have been borne by the other party.
Kid related expenses will be split temporarily 50/50. We will need to align what these are like tuition, camp fees, school related expenses etc. my
suggestion is we both deposit an equal agreed upon amount from our split of funds, into the jt BofA bank account, and only use that for kids
expenses. Ie monthly tuition payments due starting July. No personal spend from that account or it will need to be reimbursed.
My income is my separate income, as is any income you may earn, and will be deposited into our separate accounts.
I will stop college contributions for the kids and savings into Vanguard until we can align what are contribution should be.
I believe the cash deposit from your Deferred Comp plan was earned during the marriage, as are your remaining RSUs that are vesting. Those should
be preserved until final asset split. I will treat the vesting Sbux RSUs granted during our marriage the same way. How these are treated will be finalized
in the split.

You were talking about something else.

Ok... thanks for the call. Let me know your format and time to talk. Let's both remove ourselves from the emotion, advocate for Christine and
Robert, and know when to "parking lot items" that you and I might be engaged with our attorneys on. Neither of us is comfortable making unilateral
decisions separate from our counsel, as demonstrated by your history with the pareting plans.
I don't want to get into a tit for tat:
- Christine- why haven't you sent the Hong Kong release?
- Robert, why haven't you fixed the incorrect RO on record?
Our OFW is filled with you saying, "Speak to your lawyer." I have respected that, and let's use your same tool to avoid conflict here. But if we can
figure things out peacefully, that will be very helpful and save us money. Even if it is for only 50% of the things, that is 50% we will save on.
If you start, you start your list here. I will tag along. We agree not to make characterizations or imply decisions but just use the "line item" and "action

item" format. If we both agree on something, we can type it up in real-time together rather than bicker after the fact.

will think about her proposal, and will come back with recommendation.

I swear to god, Christine. There were so many better ways to have done this. I was so onboard for us and the boys. Also the healthiest I had (and we
had) ever been.
If you had just said- "let's take care of my scar tissue like you have been asking me to do" or even "i'm still gonna leave you, but let's do it peacefully and
in a healthy way"
I will never understand why you had to do it this way. If there was damage before, what is there now?

I won’t talk to you when you pepper the communications with statements with digs and issues you state as facts and are not. I have stated repeatedly I
refuse to defend or refute because that’s how you draw me into a longer conversation and confrontation.
You then accuse me of not working with you.
The finances are a known, the timing and what the amounts we need to pay are. They are due Robert. The mortgage, the tuition. To act any different
is disingenuous.
